entry.title: S4HANA Public Cloud (INDIA) - ODN for Supplier Reduction - Doc Type RK
entry.content:
We are using S/4HANA public cloud and need help in ODN Config for Supplier Credit Memo

Scenario:

We receive a supplier invoice.

If there is short receipt for Invoice,  receipt is done for actual qty where as invoiced qty is captured in Delivery Note Qty.

Invoice is posted using Invoice Reduction method, two accounting documents are generated (Doc type RE and RK) which is ok.

Question:  Config to generate ODN Number for Invoice Reduction Document (RK) and print of Supplier Debit Note ?

Best Regards

Gurjit Singh

So can someone guide me with this scenario ?

Best Regards,

Dinesh U

entry.title: G/L account Company Code Data API
entry.content:
Dear All,

We are looking for an API to provide GL Account Company Code Data.

We have only identified 'G/L Account - Read' ODATA V2 API https://api.sap.com/api/API_GLACCOUNTINCHARTOFACCOUNTS_SRV/overview

which only provides GL Account in Chart of Accounts.

Is there an API to provide the GL Account in Company Code Data?

Thank you

entry.title: Are tax categories for US and CR are missing in the system?
entry.content:
Hi,

 

We are checking the standard tax categories in the system and having below doubts:

Question 1:

USX - DUNS number - There is no standard tax category available to store DUNS number. is that correct?

Question 2:

CRX - Costa Rica - CEDULA JURIDICA - This can be stored in CR3 (Costa Rica: Tax Identification Number) tax category. is that correct?

We do not want to create custom codes if standard meets. If anyone has knowledge around this please help.

Thanks

entry.title: Adding an Additional Procedure to Existing Serial Number Profile with Stock – Impact
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We have a question regarding Serial Number Profile configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

In our productive system, we would like to add an additional procedure (ADVR) to an existing serial number profile that is already assigned to materials with available stock.

Important points:

  • The serial number profile itself will remain unchanged
  • Only an additional procedure is appended
  • Existing serial numbers and stock data are not intended to be altered

As per general SAP guidance, changing serial number profiles for materials with stock is not recommended.
In SAP Note 3132393, the proposed approach includes:

  • Removing all stock from storage locations
  • Changing the serial number profile
  • Reposting the stock afterward

However, this process is not feasible in our productive environment.

From a configuration perspective, this is more of a procedural extension rather than a profile change, so we would like to understand how the system behaves in this scenario.

My questions to the community:

  • Has anyone added an additional procedure to an existing serial number profile with stock in S/4HANA Cloud, public edition?
  • Did you experience any technical issues or inconsistencies with existing stock or serial numbers?
  • Is the stock-clearing approach in Note 3132393 strictly required only for profile changes, or does it also apply to procedure extensions?

 

Any insights, best practices, or real-life experiences would be greatly appreciated.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

@Caner_Demircan

entry.title: Mandatory Serial Number Verification in Public Cloud RF
entry.content:
When picking serialized materials, we want to make it PERSON_NAME to verify the number of serial numbers and their values. Currently, RF in public cloud only requires this verification if you are picking a partial quantity and need to specify which serial numbers are being picked. Is there a way to customize this functionality, or is it suggested to build a custom Fiori app for picking? 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Stock & Quality Management by Handling Unit (Bags / Pallets) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am currently working on an implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud – Public Edition, and I have some questions regarding stock management and quality inspection at Handling Unit (HU) level.

1. Stock visibility by Handling Unit (Bags / Pallets)

I am not asking about HU tracking itself (creation, movement, or identification of HUs), but rather about stock visibility and inventory from a business point of view.

My questions are:

  • Is it possible in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to:

    • See how many bags of a specific material are available in stock?

    • See how many pallets of a material exist in stock?

  • Can we perform inventory counting based on Handling Units (for example: inventory by pallet or by bag), instead of only quantity in base unit of measure?

In other words, can we use Handling Units as a stock analysis and inventory dimension, not only as a logistical object?

2. Quality Management by Handling Unit

In addition, I would like to know if Quality Inspection by Handling Unit is supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

  • Is it possible to perform quality inspection at HU level (for example: inspection per pallet or per bag)?

  • Can inspection lots, results, or usage decisions be managed per Handling Unit, and not only at material / batch level?

From my understanding so far, Quality Management in Public Cloud seems to be mainly material- and batch-based, but I would like to confirm whether there are standard capabilities, configuration options, or known limitations regarding HU-based quality control.

3. Standard vs Limitations

If these scenarios are not supported, I would highly appreciate:

  • Confirmation of the limitation in Public Cloud

  • Any recommended workaround 

  • Clarification if this is supported only in Private Cloud / On-Premise

Thank you in advance for your support and insights.

Best regards,

entry.title: Asking for CDS View for Free Form Payment App (F2564)
entry.content:
Dear all,

As far as I am aware, the Free Form Payment app (F2564) saves its data in the CDS view I_PaymentRequest. However, this CDS view is not available for use in Cloud Development.

Could you please advise which CDS view should be used to access and retrieve the data generated by the Free Form Payment app? Please note that the CDS view should be leveraged for custom development in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud environment.

Please note that I'm working with Public Cloud.

Thank you for your support.

Regards, Eric

entry.title: Can the cost center cost allocation cycle rule select actual activities? -UESER ID:CB9980000032
entry.content:
1.APP is Manage Allocations,you can find allocation cycles-Z001

2.And then you can find Segments of the allocation cycles-Z00101

3.IF the receiver rule what we choose is Variable portions, we need choose Var.Portion Type,We cann't find Actual Activity, is this because the SAP public cloud does not support the method of using actual activities, or is the inability to select it caused by missing configurations?

entry.content:

entry.title: Migration cockpit- AA upload function
entry.content:
We are currently experiencing issues with the Migration Cockpit related to asset uploads, as outlined below:

  1. Fixed Asset Posting – Unplanned Depreciation
    In the upload template for Fixed Asset Posting, there is no field available for unplanned depreciation. Could you please advise whether there is an updated template or an alternative function that supports mass upload of unplanned depreciation postings?

  2. Fixed Asset Master Data – Time-Based Valuation
    In the upload template for Fixed Asset Master Data → Time-Based Valuation, we are able to flag the Asset Shutdown indicator. However, we cannot find any column that allows us to input the date interval. We currently need to upload assets with more than one interval period. Could you please advise how this can be achieved using the Migration Cockpit?

Your guidance on the above would be greatly appreciated.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Which SAP IAS tenant should be used for SAP BTP when configuring Joule in S/4HANA Cloud Public?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We are currently working on the configuration of Joule for a project running on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and we have an architecture-related question regarding Identity Authentication Service (IAS).

In our landscape, we have:

  • One IAS Test tenant

  • One IAS Productive tenant

As part of the Joule setup, we also have an SAP BTP tenant included in the project.

Our question is:

Which IAS tenant should be connected to the SAP BTP tenant when implementing Joule?

  • Should SAP BTP be trusted with the IAS Test tenant, or

  • Is it considered best practice to connect SAP BTP directly to the IAS Productive tenant?

Additionally, we would like to understand:

  • What is the recommended SAP best practice for this scenario?

  • Is there a typical approach during implementation phases (test vs. productive)?

  • Are there any considerations specific to S/4HANA Cloud Public + Joule that we should be aware of?

Any guidance, official documentation references, or real-project experience would be greatly appreciated.
We are especially interested in SAP-recommended architectures or official guidance for S/4HANA Cloud Public projects.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
Oscar

entry.title: Custom Reusable elements and Custom Business Objects.
entry.content:
Hello,

I would appreciate your help in sharing your thoughts on the following questions.

1. I've created a Custom Reusable Element, and I'm wondering if it's possible to enable it from the Manage Master Data app.

When I try to call it from Custom Fields, using the Type Code List based on CDs View, the custom reusable element doesn't appear.
Is this possible?

2.I have also created Custom Business Objects, when I try to call it from Custom Fields, using the Type Code List based on CDs View, the Custom Business Objects doesn't appear.

 

Note:
I have reviewed documentation or blogs but I have not been able to find the configuration I need.

I would appreciate your feedback.

Thank you very much.
